entry.def: A backyard is an area of land at the back of a house.

entry.tran: （某国的）后院（指本土或该国意欲施加影响的邻近地区）
entry.def: If you refer to a country's own backyard, you are referring to its own territory or to somewhere that is very close and where that country wants to influence events.

example.ex: Economics will not stop Europe's politicians complaining when jobs are lost in their own backyard...
example.tran: 当本国人口在失业时，经济情况是无法让欧洲的政治家停止抱怨的。

example.ex: Cuba is the largest island in the Caribbean, an area that the United States has long regarded as its own backyard.
example.tran: 古巴是加勒比地区最大的岛屿，美国长期以来一直把它看作自己的后院。

sentences.en: He stacked the firewood in the backyard.
The boys buried the dead bird in the backyard.

sentences.en: The defence party divided his backyard from that of his sister’s.
sentences.cn: 一堵共用的墙把他跟他妹妹的后院隔开了。

sentences.en: My house had a small backyard,the paradise of children.
sentences.cn: 我那幢房子有一个小后院,那是孩子们玩耍的乐园。

sentences.en: Our house is on an acre of land which gives us a nice big backyard for our garden.
sentences.cn: 我们的房子坐落在一英亩的土地上,因而后院地方很大,可供我们辟为花园。

sentences.en: The party leader is facing opposition in his own backyard .
sentences.cn: 该党领袖在自己的党內遇到了反对。

means.word_mean: <美>被看作自家后院一般的地方;邻近地区

sentences.en: Come on, I’ll give you the grand tour of the backyard.

sentences.en: The residents didn’t want a new factory in their backyard.
sentences.cn: 居民不希望在他们住地附近建新工厂。

means.word_mean: 在自己的后院；离自己的住所(或工作场所)很近的地方
